definition: to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips

sentences.english: The thinking is to incite violence against whom the sum?
sentences.chinese: 二思怂恿暴力是要跟谁闹别扭？

sentences.english: Google started its feud with the Chinese government in March.
sentences.chinese: 而3月，谷歌就和中国政府闹别扭。

sentences.english: I absolutely understand your feeling. Because it's inevitable to quarrel with your best friend.
sentences.chinese: 跟好友闹别扭，常比与情人斗气，更来得火大。

sentences.english: I was up all night with a sick child.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子只有在生病时才会闹别扭。

sentences.english: The two brothers are bickering again.
The two countries are at loggerheads over trading issues.
sentences.chinese: 两国就贸易问题闹别扭。
